Thanks all for the information.
I looked at the articles and I am left with=
 a question.
How does novelty search compare with random search of the geno=
type space? If the task is sufficiently deceptive, random search will actua=
lly outperform fitness directed search. It seems to me that the new algorit=
hm must be compared against both fitness directed search and random search.=

Preference for simple models can be incorporated into random search by giv=
ing higher probabilities to simpler models. A classic solution would be to =
let the probability decrease exponentially with the number of nodes in the =
compact description.
Are there any theoretical or practical results regardi=
ng the comparison with a random search? Do you have any estimates or ideas =
on this?
I am not saying that novelty search won't work, but I think this p=
oint must be cleared. I also want to try gain a better understanding of how=
 and why the search works.
